column4: quick question... how do I mount my master drive from my slave drive?
the mount command is your friend
cliff notes: the drive you want is probably labeled "noauto" just get rid of that and you are done :)
also pastebin a list of partitions on /dev/sda (use fdisk to do it)
blah :)  fdisk /dev/sda, and then use p
when I do when hydrogen said - i get this
so just sudo fdisk /dev/sda, and then hit p
and you want /dev/sda1?  Where on your filesystem do you want to put it?
: I dont even know what you're asking me... basically.. i want it so my master drive is automatically moutned so that when I hit "places" it's one of the options like "computer" or "documents"
ok, type mkdir /media/master (or whatever you want to call it, this name will be visible), and then add this line to the end of your /etc/fstab:  /dev/sda1 /media/master auto defaults 0 0
